question: Which are the two basin countries of the "Motagua River"?
explanation: The Motagua River is a 486-kilometre-long river flows through Guatemala and Honduras. It rises in the western highlands of Guatemala where it is also called the Rio Grande and runs in an easterly direction to the Gulf of Honduras. The final few kilometres of the river form part of the Guatemalaâ€“Honduras border. The Motagua River basin covers an area of 12,670 square kilometres and is the largest in Guatemala.
